body_html:
Tomorrow I'll run the command and post the output, but the architecture should be ppc64le (I remember seeing it in the name of the whl file). The configure script did specify -mcpu=native as the optimization flag for --config=opt, but -march=native still popped up when compiling one of the files (and consequently build failed). The problem disappeared when I built without --config=opt. Il mer 21 feb 2018, 00:10 Michael Case <notifications@github.com> ha scritto:
…
hmm, could you give more specs about your machine. Specifically, what python -c "import platform; print platform.machine()" outputs. If the above outputs 'ppc64le', then --config=opt won't add -march=native flag and will instead add -mcpu=native. — You are receiving this because you authored the thread. Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub <#17154 (comment)>, or mute the thread <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AGzyMIxvfxL2MW1XRVN2Nn8i31revd6Fks5tW1DegaJpZM4SMRcs> .

Tomorrow I'll run the command and post the output, but the architecture
should be ppc64le (I remember seeing it in the name of the whl file). The
configure script did specify -mcpu=native as the optimization flag for
--config=opt, but -march=native still popped up when compiling one of the
files (and consequently build failed). The problem disappeared when I built
without --config=opt.

…
 hmm, could you give more specs about your machine. Specifically, what

 python -c "import platform; print platform.machine()"

 outputs. If the above outputs 'ppc64le', then --config=opt won't add
 -march=native flag and will instead add -mcpu=native.

body:
Tomorrow I'll run the command and post the output, but the architecture
should be ppc64le (I remember seeing it in the name of the whl file). The
configure script did specify -mcpu=native as the optimization flag for
--config=opt, but -march=native still popped up when compiling one of the
files (and consequently build failed). The problem disappeared when I built
without --config=opt.

Il mer 21 feb 2018, 00:10 Michael Case <notifications@github.com> ha
scritto:

> hmm, could you give more specs about your machine. Specifically, what
>
> python -c "import platform; print platform.machine()"
>
> outputs. If the above outputs 'ppc64le', then --config=opt won't add
> -march=native flag and will instead add -mcpu=native.
>
> —
> You are receiving this because you authored the thread.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/17154#issuecomment-367153066>,
> or mute the thread

> .
>
